title: Antam Gold Hits New All-Time High at Rp 3.16 Mill per Gram as Global Prices Rally
body: Antam gold jumped to a new record of Rp 3.16 million per gram on Thursday, tracking a global bullion rally driven by safe-haven demand.

title: Breaking: JCI Tumbles 8% in First 30 Minutes on Thursday, Trading Halted
body: A sharp early sell-off sent the JCI down 8%, forcing a temporary halt on the Indonesia Stock Exchange.

title: JCI Extends Losses on Thursday Post MSCI Index Freeze Announcement
body: JCI fell further on Thursday morning following MSCI’s announcement of a temporary freeze on index changes for Indonesia.

title: Bio Farma to Let Go of Kimia Farma, Danantara Says
body: Danantara wants state-run enterprises in the health sector to go under the knife, citing differences in their business nature.

title: Market Sell-Off Over MSCI Report Is Temporary, Finance Minister Says
body: Indonesia’s finance minister said the stock sell-off after an MSCI report was excessive and temporary, pledging swift reforms.

title: Rupiah Rebounds on Dollar Weakness Ahead of Fed Decision
body: Rupiah strengthened against the US dollar on Wednesday as markets awaited the Federal Reserve’s policy decision.

title: Danantara Says SOE Consolidation Based on Fundamentals, Not Arbitrary Cuts
body: Danantara said SOE consolidation is based on fundamental reviews, not arbitrary cuts, as Indonesia targets stronger, competitive state firms

title: MSCI Review Triggers Sharp Sell-Off as JCI Slides 7.35%
body: JCI fell 7.35% on Wednesday after MSCI raised fresh investability and free-float concerns, triggering a broad market sell-off.

title: Perminas to Take Over Agincourt's Martabe Gold Mine: Danantara
body: Danantara, however, cannot give a timeline of when Perminas will officially take over Agincourt's Mertabe gold mine.

title: Indonesia Exceeds Budget Plan, Funds Social Aid and Infrastructure
body: KSSK said budget financing topped the APBN target at 120.7%, with debt financing managed prudently.

title: Breaking: IDX Halts Stock Trading After JCI Drops 8%
body: Indonesia’s stock exchange halts trading for 30 minutes after the Jakarta Composite Index plunges 8% to its lowest level since October.

title: Kiwoom Sees One-Week Market Overhang After MSCI News
body: JCI dropped over 7% after MSCI froze positive index treatment, with volatility expected to persist.

title: IDX, OJK Move to Calm Markets After MSCI Free-Float Review Triggers Sell-Off
body: IDX says it is engaging MSCI after free-float concerns trigger a sharp sell-off, sending the Jakarta Composite Index down nearly 7%.

title: Antam Gold Hits New Record as Prices Jump Rp 52,000 per Gram
body: Antam gold prices jumped Rp 52,000 to a fresh record on Wednesday, extending year-to-date gains beyond 17% amid global uncertainty.

title: MSCI Freeze Sparks Heavy Sell-Off as JCI Plunges Nearly 7%
body: Indonesia’s benchmark index slid nearly 7% at the open as MSCI froze positive adjustments, stoking foreign outflows and market jitters.

title: Thomas Djiwandono Pledges to Uphold BI Independence as Deputy Governor
body: Prabowo’s nephew Thomas Djiwandono vows to uphold Bank Indonesia’s independence after lawmakers approve his appointment as deputy governor.

body: BCA posted solid earnings growth in 2025, supported by steady loan expansion and strong transactional banking income.

body: Rupiah rose as investors awaited the Fed’s policy decision, with US political tensions and trade risks pressuring the dollar.

title: JCI Scrapes Gains as Foreign Net Sell, MSCI Rule Jitters Linger
body: JCI ended marginally higher after a volatile session, with foreign outflows and MSCI rule concerns capping gains.

body: The EU wishes to focus on sealing bilateral trade deals with the individual ASEAN members first before discussing a regional pact.

title: Rupiah Moves Higher as Markets Weigh Signals, Economist Urges Caution

title: End of EV Incentives Signals Policy Shift in Indonesia, Expert Says

title: Indonesia Offers New Retail Bonds with Up to 5.8% Annual Returns

title: Private Sector Key to Achieving 6–8% Growth, Deputy Finance Minister Says
body: Indonesia’s 6–8% growth dream won’t be funded by the state budget alone, with 85% of the economy driven by the private sector.

title: JCI Starts Week in Green, Tracking Global and Fed Cues

title: Indonesia to Set Tin Reference Price to Stabilize Market
body: Indonesia will soon set a minimum reference price for tin to stabilize markets, protect local miners, and support downstream investment.

title: Scrapping EV Incentives May Be Premature, Analysts Warn
body: Analysts warn ending Indonesia’s EV incentives may be premature, arguing they are a long-term investment despite limited subsidy savings.

title: Russia Says Eurasia-Indonesia Deal is Proof It Seeks Free Trade, Not Tariff Hikes

title: Indonesia Records 1.4 Billion-Liter Surplus in Diesel Supply
body: Indonesia has recorded a 1.4 billion-liter surplus in subsidized diesel supply, driven by rising biodiesel use and refinery output.

title: Indonesia Says No More C48 Diesel Imports in 2026
body: Indonesia will stop C48 diesel imports in 2026, while gasoline imports continue until 2027.

title: Investment Minister Sees Blended Finance as Key to AI Investment
body: Blended finance is key to keeping Indonesia competitive in the global AI race, Investment Minister Rosan Roeslani says.
